question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of now, Donald Trump Jr. has not formally declared his candidacy for the 2024 Republican nomination, nor has he been a leading figure in the discussions surrounding potential candidates. The Republican field includes several prominent figures, including former President Donald Trump, who may also run, as well as other established politicians. While Donald Trump Jr. has a strong name recognition due to his father's legacy, he lacks the political experience and widespread support that other candidates possess. Additionally, the dynamics of primary elections can be unpredictable, and many factors can influence the nomination process, including endorsements, fundraising, and voter sentiment. Given these circumstances, it seems unlikely that Donald Trump Jr. will emerge as the nominee.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
Assessing the likelihood of Joe Biden passing away before the specified date requires consideration of various factors, including his current health status, age, and general trends in mortality rates for individuals in his demographic. Joe Biden, as of the latest information available, is in his early 80s. While age is a factor in mortality, it does not provide a definitive prediction for any individual. 

Moreover, significant public figures often receive extensive medical care and monitoring, which can mitigate risks associated with age. There are also no current indications from credible sources regarding any imminent health crises or risks that would suggest a higher likelihood of death within the given timeframe. 

Given these considerations, while it is impossible to predict with absolute certainty, the probability of an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the specified date appears to be very low. Therefore, the probability of the question resolving YES is small.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of now, President Biden has been serving in office and there is no significant indication of imminent resignation or health issues that would lead to his death before the end of July 2024. While political landscapes can change rapidly, Biden has shown resilience and has a support base that may help him navigate challenges. Additionally, the likelihood of a significant political event that could lead to his removal or resignation within this timeframe seems low, barring unforeseen circumstances. Therefore, the probability of him remaining in office through the end of July 2024 appears to be relatively high.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday or will he cease to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if either (a) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Joe Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO if neither condition is met.

Note: Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Joe Biden, as of the current date, is the sitting President of the United States. While there are always uncertainties regarding health and political circumstances, there is no substantial evidence suggesting that he is in immediate danger of dying or resigning before the specified dates. Historically, presidents have maintained their positions unless there are significant health issues or political crises. Additionally, considering the political landscape, it is unlikely that he would resign without a major catalyst. Therefore, while it is impossible to completely rule out these events, the probability of either condition (death or resignation) occurring before the end of July 2024 appears to be low.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Joe Biden's decision regarding the 2024 presidential nomination is influenced by various factors, including his current political standing, public opinion, and the Democratic Party's dynamics. As of now, Biden has not made any definitive statements indicating he will not seek re-election, and he has historically been a candidate who has run for re-election. Additionally, the political landscape can change rapidly, and Biden may choose to run again if he feels confident about his chances. Given the timeline leading up to July 15, 2024, and the lack of any strong indicators suggesting he will step down from the race, it seems more likely that he will not make an announcement to decline the nomination. Therefore, the probability that he will announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination is relatively low.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess whether Kamala Harris's odds of winning will increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, we need to consider several factors. First, Nate Silver's model is based on polling data, historical trends, and statistical analysis. As the election approaches, polling data can fluctuate due to various events such as debates, campaign strategies, or shifts in public opinion.

As of now, we should analyze the current probability for Harris and any recent trends in polling data. If her current probability is close to or above the 46.6% threshold, and if there are indications of positive momentum (e.g., favorable news cycles, strong campaign events, or shifts in voter sentiment), it is plausible that her odds could increase.

However, if she is currently below this threshold, the likelihood of crossing it in a week may depend heavily on external factors, such as competing candidates' performances or major news events impacting public perception. Given the dynamic nature of electoral politics, it is difficult to predict with certainty.

Considering these factors, I would estimate that the probability of her odds increasing to above 46.6% is moderate, reflecting both potential for growth and the inherent unpredictability of electoral dynamics.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It resolves as No otherwise.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the likelihood of either Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination or Kamala Harris's odds of winning increasing, we need to consider the political context and current events leading up to the resolution date.

(a) Joe Biden's announcement: As of now, there is no indication that Biden intends to step down or not seek re-election. Historically, sitting presidents tend to seek re-election unless there are compelling reasons such as health issues or significant political pressure. Given that Biden has not indicated any intention to withdraw, the probability of him making such an announcement before July 15, 2024, seems low.

(b) Kamala Harris's odds: The second part of the question hinges on Nate Silver's model, which reflects the political landscape, including polling data and public sentiment. If Harris's odds are currently low, they would need a significant shift in public opinion or a change in the political environment to increase within a week. Given the unpredictable nature of political events, it's possible, but not guaranteed, that her odds could improve.

Overall, both scenarios seem unlikely to occur independently, but there is a possibility that Harris's odds could increase even if Biden does not announce his withdrawal. However, the probability of both occurring is lower than the probability of at least one happening.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question revolves around the interpretation and enforcement of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, which disqualifies individuals from holding office if they have engaged in insurrection or rebellion against the United States. As of now, there are ongoing discussions and legal analyses regarding whether Donald Trump's actions could be construed as insurrection, and thus whether he could be disqualified from the ballot. However, the actual removal or blocking from the ballot would depend on various factors, including state laws, court rulings, and political dynamics. As of now, it seems unlikely that a significant number of states would take the steps necessary to remove Trump from the ballot by the specified date, given the political implications and the contentious nature of the issue. While there may be legal challenges and discussions leading up to the primary elections, the resolution of this question as "Yes" would require definitive actions by state governments or courts, which currently appears to be a low probability scenario.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of now, Donald Trump has a significant influence within the Republican Party and remains a leading figure among potential candidates for the 2024 presidential election. His popularity among the Republican base is strong, and he has consistently led in primary polls against other candidates. While there are other contenders, including former and current politicians, Trump's established support and ability to mobilize voters give him a considerable advantage. Additionally, the Republican National Convention will take place in mid-2024, allowing ample time for political dynamics to unfold, but given the current landscape, it appears likely that he will secure the nomination. However, unforeseen developments, such as changes in public opinion or unexpected candidates entering the race, could alter this scenario. Nevertheless, based on current trends and Trump's ongoing prominence, I assess a high probability that he will be the nominee.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This condition is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question revolves around two scenarios: either Donald Trump being blocked from the ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment or him being the Republican nominee for the 2024 presidential election. 1. **Blocking from the Ballot**: The legal grounds for removing a candidate under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment are complex and historically significant. This section was designed to prevent individuals who have engaged in insurrection against the U.S. from holding office. While there have been discussions and legal challenges regarding Trump's eligibility based on this section, as of now, there has been no definitive ruling or widespread movement among states to block him from the ballot. Legal challenges can take time and may not resolve in a way that affects his eligibility by the specified date. 2. **Republican Nomination**: On the other hand, Donald Trump has maintained a strong base within the Republican Party and has been leading in various polls regarding the 2024 nomination. The Republican National Convention is likely to reflect the preferences of the party's electorate, many of whom still support Trump. Given the current political landscape, it seems plausible that he could be nominated if he continues to maintain his support among Republican voters. Given these points, while the potential for legal challenges exists, the likelihood of Trump being blocked from the ballot is relatively low. Conversely, the probability of him being the Republican nominee is significantly higher. Therefore, I would estimate that the overall probability of either condition occurring (which resolves the question as "Yes") is quite high.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

metadata.chain_of_thought: For Kamala Harris to be designated as President or Acting President before the specified date of July 26, 2024, several factors must be considered. The most likely scenarios for such a designation would involve President Joe Biden either resigning, being incapacitated, or being removed from office. As of now, President Biden has been in office and has shown no signs of resignation or incapacity. Additionally, the political landscape is relatively stable, with no immediate threats to Biden's presidency that would suggest a change in leadership is imminent. While there could be unforeseen events that might lead to such a designation, the current context does not support a high likelihood of Kamala Harris becoming President or Acting President before the deadline. Therefore, I would assess the probability of this market resolving to 'Yes' as low.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of the current date, July 8, 2024, Joe Biden is the sitting President and has been actively campaigning for re-election. There are no significant indications or credible reports suggesting that he plans to drop out of the race before the specified date of July 20, 2024. Given the political context, the support he has from the Democratic Party, and the lack of any major health issues or scandals that could force him to withdraw, it seems unlikely that he would step down in such a short timeframe. Therefore, the probability of him dropping out before July 20 is low.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris be president by July 26 or Biden drop out by July 20?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered. (b) President Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time. If neither event occurs, the question resolves to "No."

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the likelihood of either Kamala Harris becoming president or Biden dropping out, we need to consider several factors. 

1. **Kamala Harris as President**: For Kamala Harris to be formally designated as President or Acting President, there would need to be a significant political event, such as Biden resigning, being incapacitated, or being impeached. Currently, there is no strong indication that Biden is at risk of stepping down or facing a situation that would lead to Harris taking over the presidency. The Biden administration has been relatively stable, and he has publicly expressed intentions to run for re-election in 2024.

2. **Biden Dropping Out**: The possibility of President Biden dropping out before July 20, 2024, is also low at this moment. Biden has shown resilience in his presidency, and despite facing challenges, he has a solid support base within the Democratic Party. Unless there are dramatic developments, such as health issues or political scandals, it is unlikely he would voluntarily withdraw from the race.

Given these considerations, the probability of either Kamala Harris becoming president or Biden dropping out before the specified dates appears low. Both scenarios require significant changes in the current political landscape, and as of now, there are no strong indicators that such changes are imminent.
